greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of squarefree integers between prime(n) and prime(n+1).
link: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: Between 113 and 127 the 6 squarefree numbers are 114, 115, 118, 119, 122, 123, so a(30)=6.
program: (PARI) { n=0; q=2; forprime (p=3, prime(1001), a=0; for (i=q+1, p-1, a+=issquarefree(i)); write("b061398.txt", n++, " ", a); q=p ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Jul 22 2009
(PARI) a(n) = my(pp=prime(n)+1); sum(k=pp, nextprime(pp)-1, issquarefree(k)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 28 2019
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 07 2001
